name: Reverse Spherification

ingredients.name: Flavour Liquid
ingredients.notes: This method works with Alcohol and dairy

ingredients.name: Xanthan Gum
ingredients.notes: optional, Pinch, Helps for some Alcohol or Watery Juices

directions: Add 2% Calcium Lactate Gluconate by weight to the Flavour Liquid
Pour into spherical mold and freeze
Drop frozen sphere into a warm Sodium Alginate bath (~50-60 °C)
If using Diary you can add less or potentially no Calcium Lactate Gluconate and just roll it from the spoon into the bath
These can be stored for a while, keeping them in a container with the liquid they were made from (without any gelling agents) works well

name: Snow
directions: Put Tapioca Maltodextrin in a bowl and slowly drizzle fat while mixing (food processor works well)
Sift through a sieve onto whatever
If it looks like paste or is clumpy, you need more Maltodextrin
For "soil" it's the same, but use chocolate or browned butter (can add cookie crumble for more texture too)

name: Spherification

ingredients.name: Flavoured Liquid
ingredients.notes: Whatever you want to be a spehere of

directions: Dissolve Sodium Alginate in a pan with ¼ of the flavoured liquid; Bring to simmer while whisking
Remove from heat and add in the rest of the flavoured liquid; Whisk in the Sodium Citrate; Let cool in fridge (2-4 hours or until there's no gas/bubbles)
Mix Calcium Chloride with Water when ready

Pearls: Use syringe or squeeze bottle
Spheres: Use a spherical spoon (Need to roll it in, almost like poached eggs)
The longer they sit in the liquid the thicker the skin is, pearls can get gummy quick; They will keep gelling once removed, so make only when ready to use
Use slotted spoon to remove and rinse in the filtered water

If you get tails, you're dropping from too high up.
If it's not setting add more Sodium Citrate.
